revised_title: Enzymes of Glycolysis: Structure, Activity, and Evolution - Second Session Insights
tldr: This article discusses various aspects of enzyme structure and function in glycolysis, with a focus on the second session of a meeting. Presentations cover topics such as enzyme catalysis, control mechanisms, and the use of nuclear magnetic resonance (NMR) to study enzyme-substrate complexes and reaction rates in vivo. The article highlights the importance of understanding enzyme behavior in both isolated and living systems.
